required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Performance Comparison of Masimo O3 Regional Oximetry Sensors in Neonates
clinical_study.official_title: Performance Comparison of Masimo O3 Regional Oximetry Sensors in Neonates

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to compare the performance of the O3 cerebral oximeter and sensor to a 510(k) cleared NIRS (Near-Infrared Spectroscopy) device on neonatal subjects based on data collected from the cutaneously placed forehead sensors. Due to the design of the systems, the devices will be used serially instead of concurrently. Because of this timing, changes in patient state may not be reflected in measurements collected by both devices.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sponsor terminated study due to project timeline.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With rSO2 Collected
primary_outcome.time_frame: Data collection period; alternating sensors every 5 minutes for up to 20 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: In order to obtain the RMS value, rSO2 values collected from the control device (510(k) cleared regional oximetry sensor) is subtracted from the rSO2 values collected from the investigational device (Masimo O3 neonatal sensors) for a number of samples, the average of this difference is computed as the bias. The standard deviation of the differences is computed as the precision. The square root of the sum of the squares of bias and precision is computed as the RMS Error value.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive a Masimo O3 Neonatal sensors as well as a 510(k) cleared sensor.

intervention.description: Cleared Regional Oximetry sensor for Neonates

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Less than 10 kg
- Subjects less than or equal to 28 days old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Underdeveloped skin at sites of sensor placement
- Jaundice or bilirubin levels out of normal range
- Subject has skin abnormalities affecting the sensor placement area such as psoriasis, eczema, angioma, scar tissue, burn, fungal infection, or substantial skin breakdown that would prevent monitoring of oxygenation levels during the study
- Subject deemed not eligible based on Principal Investigator's judgment

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

outcome.title: Number of Participants With rSO2 Collected
outcome.description: In order to obtain the RMS value, rSO2 values collected from the control device (510(k) cleared regional oximetry sensor) is subtracted from the rSO2 values collected from the investigational device (Masimo O3 neonatal sensors) for a number of samples, the average of this difference is computed as the bias. The standard deviation of the differences is computed as the precision. The square root of the sum of the squares of bias and precision is computed as the RMS Error value.
outcome.time_frame: Data collection period; alternating sensors every 5 minutes for up to 20 minutes.
outcome.population: Study was prematurely terminated. Study did not reach the target number of subjects needed to achieve minimum sample size determination and was insufficient to produce statistically reliable results.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Study did not reach the target number of subjects needed to achieve minimum sample size determination and was insufficient to produce statistically reliable results.
